intro: Torilis macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited hedge parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits that are typically brown when mature. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found along roadsides or in woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is sometimes grown in gardens.
